questions.question: 彼は周囲に気を使いすぎて、つい本音を（＿）ことが多い。
questions.hint:
周囲しゅうい (shuui) - surroundings
本音ほんね (honne) - true feelings

explanation.correct:
Correct! : 隠すかくす (kakusu) - to hide one’s true feelings

  • 見せるみせる (miseru) - to show
  • 曝け出すさらけだす (sarakedasu) - to expose openly
  • 語るかたる (kataru) - to talk in detail

He is too considerate of others and often hides his true feelings.
explanation.incorrect:
Answer: 隠すかくす (kakusu) - to hide one’s true feelings

  • 見せるみせる (miseru) - to show
  • 曝け出すさらけだす (sarakedasu) - to expose openly
  • 語るかたる (kataru) - to talk in detail

He is too considerate of others and often hides his true feelings.

questions.question: この提案にはいくつか（＿）があるため、もう少し検討が必要だ。
questions.hint:
提案ていあん (teian) - proposal
検討けんとう (kentou) - consideration

explanation.correct:
Correct! : 問題点もんだいてん (mondaiten) - problems/issues

  • 長所ちょうしょ (chousho) - strengths
  • 改善かいぜん (kaizen) - improvements
  • 解決策かいけつさく (kaiketsusaku) - solutions

This proposal has some problems and needs further consideration.

questions.question: 彼の発言は部長の意見と（＿）していたため、場の空気が悪くなった。
questions.hint:
発言はつげん (hatsugen) - statement
場の空気ばのくうき (ba no kuuki) - atmosphere

explanation.correct:
Correct! : 対立たいりつ (tairitsu) - conflict/opposition

  • 一致いっち (icchi) - agreement
  • 賛成さんせい (sansei) - approval
  • 応援おうえん (ouen) - support

His statement clashed with the boss’s opinion, worsening the atmosphere.

questions.question: チャンスを（＿）ためには、準備を怠らないことが大切だ。
questions.hint:
準備じゅんび (junbi) - preparation
怠るおこたる (okotaru) - to neglect

explanation.correct:
Correct! : 掴むつかむ (tsukamu) - to grab/seize

  • 離すはなす (hanasu) - to release
  • 逃すのがす (nogasu) - to miss (a chance)
  • 折るおる (oru) - to break

To seize a chance, it’s important not to neglect preparation.
explanation.incorrect:
Answer: 掴むつかむ (tsukamu) - to grab/seize

  • 離すはなす (hanasu) - to release
  • 逃すのがす (nogasu) - to miss (a chance)
  • 折るおる (oru) - to break

questions.question: 彼は大企業を（＿）して、自分の会社を立ち上げた。
questions.hint:
大企業だいきぎょう (daikigyou) - large company
立ち上げるたちあげる (tachiageru) - to start (a business)

explanation.correct:
Correct! : 辞職じしょく (jishoku) - resignation

  • 転職てんしょく (tenshoku) - job change
  • 起業きぎょう (kigyou) - entrepreneurship (noun, not an action here)
  • 解雇かいこ (kaiko) - dismissal

He resigned from a large company to start his own business.
explanation.incorrect:
Answer: 辞職じしょく (jishoku) - resignation

  • 転職てんしょく (tenshoku) - job change
  • 起業きぎょう (kigyou) - entrepreneurship (noun)
  • 解雇かいこ (kaiko) - dismissal
